body:
Appreciate the thoughtful reply. A few replies:

- RE: Builders: I took those guidelines to mean that that builders are great as a replacement for factory methods when there are many parameters, or optional parameters or when calling code is less self-documenting that it should be. However, in this particular case, the proposal is to have only a single constructor (`new Scope(graph)`) and then named methods for child scopes (`withFoo()`), hence I don't think the preconditions for those guidelines are met. The builder in this PR is private and used for the implementation and IMHO in this case they are making the implementation harder to follow. So, I'd like to lean against the use of the private builders here. Sound fair?

- RE: Helper scopes: I see. IIUC, you're trying to encapsulate all the state needed for "names" in one class, all the state needed for "control dependencies" in another class etc. So, instead of having each `withFoo()` method worry about how it handles every private state member of the `Scope` class, it can deal with groups? I can buy that - let's see how things look once the builders are gone (I suspect the implementation of both classes will become much smaller) and see how it goes then.
